basics.name: Dr Golo Henseke
basics.label: Associate Professor
basics.summary: Dr Golo Henseke is an Associate Professor at the UCL Institute of Education. His research focuses on skills, labour markets, technological change, subjective well-being and quantitative measurement methods. He has expertise in designing and managing large survey datasets, conducting complex statistical analysis, and leading large-scale research projects. His work is published in Oxford Economic Papers, ILR Review, British Journal of Industrial Relations, and New Technology, Work and Employment.

work.name: UCL Institute of Education
work.summary: Associate Professor conducting research on skills, labour markets, technological change, and subjective well-being. Department Graduate Tutor since 2024. CDE Lead for Quantitative Methods Teaching, 2017-2025.
highlights: CDE Lead for Quantitative Methods Teaching
Research on skills and labour markets

work.name: UCL Institute of Education
work.summary: Applied economic research on skills formation, education choices and outcomes, and graduate labour markets. Designed, developed, and delivered research independently and in collaboration with interdisciplinary academics.

work.name: UK Commission for Employment and Skills
work.summary: Quantitative research support and consultancy work on skills utilisation and development.
highlights: Designed and Delivered research on skills and learning

work.name: University of Rostock and Institute for Employment Research
work.summary: Planned, developed, and delivered a project to measure occupation-specific skills shortages in Germany. Developed and delivered seminars on macroeconomic theory and applied economic research.

courses: Essays on labour market consequences and challenges of demographic change

education.area: Economics with a minor in sociology
courses: Innovation and economic growth in an ageing society

awards.title: ESRC - Skills and Employment Survey 2023: Continuity and Change

ESRC - Centre for Global Higher Education
awards.summary: Project Lead (PI: S Marginson). Nov 2020 - Oct 2023. £1,489,019

awards.title: Nuffield - Competitive Effects of Free Schools in England

projects.name: ADR UK Research Fellowship
projects.summary: ESRC-funded research fellowship focusing on administrative data research applications in labour markets and skills.

projects.name: Skills and Employment Survey 2023
projects.summary: Major longitudinal survey examining continuity and change in skills and employment in the UK. Led by Professor Alan Felstead.

projects.name: Youth Economic Activity and Health (YEAH) Monitor
projects.summary: Research project tracking the impact of economic activity on young people's health and well-being during and after COVID-19.

projects.name: Centre for Global Higher Education
projects.summary: Research centre examining global trends in higher education, graduate outcomes, and labour market transitions.
